Recommended to new police officers by their training departments, Pocket Sergeant has become the biggest user- led policing app. 

It is the, “go to” app for police officers, police staff, detention officers, PCSOs, law students, solicitors as well as any members of the public within England and Wales with an interest in the UK criminal justice system. 

Join our closed Facebook group and have a say in what content / features you would like to see. Users have shaped the app into what it is today.

Pocket Sergeant enables you to;

* Search criminal law definitions and points to prove in England & Wales by name and Act / Section

*Search crimes by key words

*Print / share crimes

* What3Words integration

* Cake offences

* Night Mode option

* Case file help

* Police Regulations

* Police recruitment videos

* Learn whether there is sufficient to charge a suspect (offence specific)

* When a crime report should be submitted (offence specific)

* Contacts section containing police force and partner agency telephone numbers

* Keep your work life separate with the built in Calendar

* Witness statement checklists to ensure all key points are met

* CCCJS Codes

* Reference Library to view PDFs offline such as the PACE Codes of Practice

* Use Quick Scroll icons to find what information you want more quickly

******

In order to keep the app evolving at such a fast rate, we introduced a small subscription for users who wished to received regular legislative updates.

A valid subscription is required to receive legislative database updates - The subscription can be purchased within the app on a monthly automatically renewing basis. The subscription required is called "1 month auto renewing - LAW Database Update Subscription" - The subscription cost is £0.99 per month and a 1 month FREE trial is available for any new subscriber and will be credited on first subscription.

The subscription will automatically renew every 1 month unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period and will charge your iTunes account within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You may cancel or manage the subscription by going to the Account Settings on your device

Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable

Once a subscription has expired you will no longer receive updates to the LAW database. If no subscription is purchased the Database will not update past it's current state at 9:00am on 01/06/2017.

Duty Pro is the only pocket police guide app to provide you with a comprehensive list of criminal offences in both simple and ‘Guidethrough’ modes, walking you through every step of the investigation process and providing you with offence specific requirements along the way.

No monthly subscriptions, no catch. Just a one-off fee and it's yours. With no time-consuming or delinquent application updates required to maintain correct information, Duty Pro is supremely powerful.

Duty Pro is revolutionising the way British police officers maintain their status as the world's best. It provides you with a formidable and highly effective tool to look up and reference criminal and traffic offences and procedures during the course of your investigations.

With the option of two outstanding display modes, you can decide how you'd like Duty Pro to present the information to you.

In ‘Simple’ mode, Duty Pro will show you everything you need to know about the offence, including offence wording, prosecution time limits, charging codes and maximum sentences. All designed in a clear and easy to navigate interface. 

In the exceptional ‘Guidethrough’ mode, not only will it display everything you will see in ‘Simple’ mode, it is smartly and dynamically written to walk you through exactly what steps you should be taking both legally and procedurally. Broken down into easily-identifiable stages of the investigative process, Duty Pro will assist you through the initial account right through to court procedures.

Also included is:

• A convenient contacts list, providing helpful contact information of police services and other linked organisations around the country which contains (where available):

	• Specific police service telephone number, email address and website
	• Force PNC and Home Office radio codes
	• Integrated map locating the force headquarters and directions

• A wellbeing directory, providing information to users on where help can be obtained from everything including mental health to financial services to Police Officers.

• A document library, providing an array of useful PDF documents and publications for police officers and victims from various organisations.

Duty Pro is perfect not only for police officers but for other members of the policing family including PCSOs, Special Constables, and civilian investigators. Written in lay terms, it has helped law students, appropriate adults, solicitors, and legal advocates better understand the policing procedures available to them.

A genuine pocket police guide, all in the palm of your hand.

The only birdsong app that can safely be used on nature reserves!
Featured by Apple in 'Celebrate Springtime’ and "App of the Day".

ChirpOMatic is an excellent way to identify bird sounds around you. Simply record a bird singing and use automatic recognition to identify it. The app can work wherever you are - if you don’t have internet or a mobile connection then the app analyses the sound on the device. And unlike other bird apps, our special Bird-Safe mode means that the app can even be used in nature reserves without the risk of disturbing birds. 

The app works rather like Shazam® does for music. When you hear a bird, quickly hold up your phone and start recording. The app analyses the sound, and shows you the top matches. You can compare your recording with the reference samples to check the identification. And if you don't have your phone with you, you can use your Apple Watch to record sounds for identification later.

All your recordings are stored on your phone so you can listen to them again or share them with friends. You can help us improve the app by sending us the sound to use in training our system. The best recordings are posted (with your permission) on the Xeno-canto website, the world-wide resource for bird and bird sound research.

summary.label:
The original and the best, accept no cheap imitations ! 
Record a bird singing and use Automatic Recognition to help identify it. Unlike all other apps, no internet or mobile connection is needed.

•   The Times Newspaper said the app "Does what it says on the 

tin" and were amazed that "this astonishing piece of software 
costs about the same as a cup of coffee".

•   "In direct comparison Bird Song Id showed better results than Chirpomatic". - naturschutz.ch - Swiss Birding Magazine 

Copied by a few, bettered by none, Bird Song Id is three years  
ahead of anyone else in this field !

•   The Telegraph Newspaper said "Bird Song Id is a good walk improved, and may even put a spring in your step".

•   over 1000 good ratings

Automatic Recognition takes place on the device, no connection to the internet or mobile network is needed.

Automatic Recognition needs good quality recordings to work. See the HELP below, or follow the Developer Website link to find out how to improve your recordings.

Automatic Recognition will help identify a good cross section of bird song in the British Isles, but you will need a good quality recording. Lots of blue and green peaks reaching to the top of the analysis graph is a good indication of a quality recording. Help and examples are included in the app to guide you.

How successful is it ? Our aim is to get the correct bird in the top three of those listed. In our testing of over 1,000 samples we found the success rate to be 85%.

Follow the Developer Website link to see a demo of Automatic Recognition on YouTube

--------------- HELP ----------------

Automatic Recognition needs a good quality recording of the bird.
-------------
Only record when a single bird is singing, or when a single bird is dominant
-------------
The analysis graph should have plenty of blue and green colors with few or no black peaks.
-------------
The peaks on the graph should reach all the way to the top. Low peaks indicate poor quality and recognition is unlikely.
-------------
The Audio Quality, shown at the top of the results screen, should be at least Good, and preferably Very Good or Excellent
-------------
The highest score should be above 70% to be useful. Below this and the system is telling you it is not sure what the song is.
-------------
A difference between two birds of less than 10% is not that significant, so listen to the samples from both to help you further
-------------
See the samples for how the analysis graph should look (to see the samples press the sample button at the top right of the help page)
-------------
Make sure it is very quiet apart from the bird song which should be nice and loud
-------------
Be as close to the bird as you can be without disturbing it
-------------
Be patient, dont expect miracles, the system works but needs good clear recordings
-------------
The microphone is at the bottom of an iPhone, point the bottom of the phone towards the bird
-------------
Remove the case from your iPhone if you use one as this can dampen the microphone
-------------
Record a single bird at a time
-------------
Capture at least two singing episodes if you can. 
-------------
Record for the full 30 seconds
-------------
Avoid windy conditions. Air moving over the microphone will mask the bird sounds
-------------
Make sure there is plenty of life in the battery. Your device will reduce power going to the microphone as the battery runs down
-------------
Playing songs to the app from recorded material on the internet, other apps or CDs is unlikely to work as this material is digitally processed and edited (inter phase gaps are often shortened). They sound very different to recording birds for real on an iPhone or iPad in the natural environment. Its a bit like putting rocket fuel in a lawn mower.
-------------

This boating, sailing and marine app provides all skippers, sailors, boaters and fishermen with the essential quick reference knowledge they need to quickly recognise and interpret the buoys and the light markers and improve your overall boating skills and safety on the water, as specified by the International Association of Lighthouse Authorities (IALA) Systems A & B.

Whether out on the water or on shore, in daylight, darkness or poor visibility, simply open the app and search the buoys, beacons, markers and lights in seconds to find the appropriate rule and definition.

- No internet connection required.
- Simple, easy to use navigation for quick reference.
- Every IALA buoyage marker available at the touch of a finger.
- Expertly drawn illustrations accompanied by clear, concise descriptions

If you are responsible for a vessel at sea, no matter how small or large, you must be able to recognise different types of navigation marks, day or night, and know what they mean.

This Buoys & Lights app will help improve your overall boating skills and safety on the water.

Buoys & Lights is designed to help all recreational and professional seafarers learn and understand the world buoyage systems which are organised by the International Association of Lighthouse Authorities (IALA).

There are two systems in use, IALA A and IALA B and they are both explained fully in this app.
There are 4 main sections in this boating safety app:

1. Buoyage: A graphic reference guide with 70 illustrations and captions which explain the different types of buoy, their uses, appearance, permutations and light characteristics.

2. Lights: A graphic reference guide with 12 illustrations and captions which explain the different types of light and their characteristics, used by beacons and lighthouses.

3. IALA Rules: The International Association of Lighthouse Authorities (IALA) rules are reproduced in full.

4. Test Yourself: A series of multiple choice questions with 35 graphic representations of buoys and lights helps you check your knowledge.

We've worked hard to uphold the highest standards of accuracy in this app and want you to enjoy this app in several ways:
- As an easy reference and revision tool 
- As a powerful visual aide-memoire 
- As an accurate source of safety information tested by marine experts 
- As a way to constantly improve your knowledge and recall via the 'test yourself" section 
- As a tool to assist you on sailing and boating courses

summary.label:
Cable size calculation done completely and accurately in seconds, providing detailed results with all correction factors used. Perform an automatic calculation where the circuit is sized automatically or enter fixed sizes to run a calculation check on an existing design. Created for electrical engineers, electricians and designers. Suitable for Industrial, Commercial or Domestic Low Voltage Circuits.

Simple, fast and reliable. 17th edition cable sizer performs cable Calculation for AC circuits in line with British Standard 7671:2008(2011) IEE Wiring regulations, without having to lookup the relevant tables.

Simply enter the circuit parameters, hit calculate, and 17th edition cable sizer does the work for you by selecting the correct cable based on current carrying capacity, earth loop impedance and voltage drop. If you want to change a parameter, go back and modify it, then re-calculate to see the difference.

Alternatively set the cable size and number of conductors in parallel and perform a calculation to check an existing design.

Results are presented in a simple format with all rating factors given, which can then be sent by email.
All rating factors are considered, all installation methods available, power factor and conductor operating temperatures are incorporated into the calculation. Parallel cables are supported automatically if current exceeds maximum available for cable type.

R1+R2, Zs and Fault currents are calculated and displayed. Automatic checks of Zs are performed for MCB's, RCBO's and BS3036 fuses.

The adiabatic calculation is also performed for applicable cable types with the ability to choose either armouring or separate CPC type. This provides circuit disconnection times based on the minimum fault current for BS88, BS1361 and BS3036 fuses.

Typical external earth loop impedances can be used based on public supply type or transformer size.

The following cables are supported (in every available size):

BS6724 Single Core and Multicore Armoured XLPE Copper/Aluminium
BS5467 Single Core and Multicore Armoured PVC Copper/Aluminium
Flat Twin and earth XLPE
Flat Twin and earth PVC
6491B Single core XLPE Copper/Aluminium
6491X Single core PVC Copper/Aluminium

The following protective devices can be used:

BS EN 60898 MCB Types B, C and D
BS EN 60947-2 MCCB
BS EN 61009-1 RCBO 30mA
BS 88 HRC Fuses
BS 3036 Rewireable Fuse
BS 1361 Cartridge Fuse

All the data is stored locally on the phone so no Internet connection is ever required.

If you like this app, please rate it. Also if you find any issues or have any suggestions for new features, please get in touch.

Also see our other free app, Cable Installer, for cable, cleats and gland sizes.
